svg.text: Complete guide to all Python operators with examples and precedence

g.text: a == b == c # all three are equal
False and expensive_function() # expensive_function not called
True or expensive_function() # expensive_function not called
x is y # True if x and y are same object
not in # Element doesn't exist in sequence
Use 'is' for None, True, False. Use '==' for value comparison.
Bitwise operators work on binary representation of numbers
→ 2 + 3 * 16 > 5 and True → 2 + 48 > 5 and True → 50 > 5 and True → True and True → True
